line_1: Obtains relief without the nauseous pill,
line_2: Or that more shocking sight the doctor's bill.

line_1: Lurks in a bolus, or informs a pill.
line_2: The Quack, once fam'd for curing ev'ry ill,

line_1: Now the distemper spite of draught or pill
line_2: Victorious seem'd, and now the doctor's skill;

line_1: Throw to the dogs your nasty pill
So I've got my good landlord to give me a pill,
line_2: But I'm told at this place 'tis genteel to be ill,

line_1: So I've got my good landlord to give me a pill,
line_2: And to add a few draughts to make up a bill.

line_1: And swallow Ruin in a golden Pill.
line_2: Who strive to climb on Fortune's slipp'ry Hill,

line_1: In the nice compound of a pill.
line_2: For, you must know, I'm fam'd for skill
Yet I can serve you but in Will,

line_1: I'll send for Misaubin, and take his pill.
line_2: Should I perchance be fashionably ill,

line_1: The pain of swallowing a pill.
line_2: Not worth, believe me, honest Will,

line_1: You'll have some loathsome pois'nous pill,
line_2: That shall disgust your palate still.

line_1: Fast and fear not — you'll need no drop nor pill:
line_2: Hunger may starve, excess is sure to kill.

line_1: Now subtle art may gild the venom'd pill,
line_2: And bait with soothing sweets destructive ill.
